div.ab: (Lines 1-24): " To the blessed and truly dearest son, Theon, curialis, city father, from Leontion, greetings in the Lord.;Inasmuch as you sent John and Eusebios and Didymos for decision in my presence, now, upon having given their argument a fair hearing, I have decided as follows: that Didymos have all the great tomb for his corpses, and, as for the small tomb, that the three, John and Eusebios and Didymos, have it, each a third share of the one tomb. And the three, John and Eusebios and Didymos, took thought of God and they left me compliantly and prayed for one another this very day, no one of them showing any signs of annoyance.; May the divine foresight pro-; tect you for a very long; time, in health; and good spirits, in; the fear of God."
